Name: False door of Iry-en-Re
Description: This small false door consists of an upper lintel, two door jambs and a sunken door niche. The rolled up mat on top of the door is missing. Instead, the two jambs are joined in the middle. The representations on the doorjambs as well as all the inscriptions are in sunk relief. The false door comes from the tomb of Iry-en-Re, situated in the western cemetery of Giza.
